verses.name: Song of Songs 2:1
verses.text: I am the rose of Sharon, and the lily of the valleys.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:2
verses.text: As the lily among thorns, so is my love among the daughters.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:3
verses.text: As the apple tree among the trees of the wood, so is my beloved among the sons. I sat down under his shadow with great delight, and his fruit was sweet to my taste.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:4
verses.text: He brought me to the banqueting house, and his banner over me was love.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:5
verses.text: Stay me with flagons, comfort me with apples: for I am sick of love.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:6
verses.text: His left hand is under my head, and his right hand doth embrace me.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:7
verses.text: I charge you, O ye daughters of Jerusalem, by the roes, and by the hinds of the field, that ye stir not up, nor awake my love, till he please.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:8
verses.text: The voice of my beloved! behold, he cometh leaping upon the mountains, skipping upon the hills.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:9
verses.text: My beloved is like a roe or a young hart: behold, he standeth behind our wall, he looketh forth at the windows, shewing himself through the lattice.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:10
verses.text: My beloved spake, and said unto me, Rise up, my love, my fair one, and come away.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:11
verses.text: For, lo, the winter is past, the rain is over and gone;

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:12
verses.text: The flowers appear on the earth; the time of the singing of birds is come, and the voice of the turtle is heard in our land;

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:13
verses.text: The fig tree putteth forth her green figs, and the vines with the tender grape give a good smell. Arise, my love, my fair one, and come away.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:14
verses.text: O my dove, that art in the clefts of the rock, in the secret places of the stairs, let me see thy countenance, let me hear thy voice; for sweet is thy voice, and thy countenance is comely.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:15
verses.text: Take us the foxes, the little foxes, that spoil the vines: for our vines have tender grapes.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:16
verses.text: My beloved is mine, and I am his: he feedeth among the lilies.

verses.name: Song of Songs 2:17
verses.text: Until the day break, and the shadows flee away, turn, my beloved, and be thou like a roe or a young hart upon the mountains of Bether.
